column4: i'm using testdisk and it says boot sector status is ok and backup boot sector status is ok and 'sectors are identical'. but when i click on 'list' it says 'can't open filesystem. Filesystem seems damaged'?
how about the smart data - any reallocated sectors?
how do i access smart data?
oops i accidentally clicked on ok somewhere and now i'm taken back to 'Analyse'. do i have to start over?
'analyse' is the first step, after i make disk selection
no sorry that was on testdisk. ok now i'm looking at disk utility and it says reallocated sector count assessment is 'good', but i didnt  run the 'run self-test'
no reallocated sectors? no pending sectors? any reported uncorrectable?
if the disk shows healthy, then maybe you corrupted the drive by shutting off the system power
'current pending sector count' says 'N/A...normalized: 200, worst: 200, threshold: 0, value'...
the Value is what you need to be concerned about
'reallocated sector count' assessemt is 'good, 'normalized: 200, worst: 200, threshold: 140, value: 0 sectors'
yes i had to do shut off the computer at times
because i couldnt shut it down normally
well at least the drive's smart thinks the disk hardware is healthy, so you just need to concentrate on repairing the partition
no i dont know how to check on reallocated sectors other than what i just typed
